title: Looking for a ligature
content:
Hi All

I am designing a logo for a event planner. I am leaning toward designing a wordmark rather than a pictoral logo. That being said, I am trying to find a clean, art-deco inspired typeface with some interesting ligatures, particularly an L with an inset E.  
So far, I have found [Cordial](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023204555/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000422#characters) and [Estilo](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023204555/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=TTT0000021#characters) (which I love - have already used it for my wedding stationery), but I would welcome a few more suggestions.

Thanks!

Natalie
author: natalie_F

comments.content: It's not art-deco, but [Classica](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023204555/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/presence_typo/classica/)’s [Prestige partner](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023204555/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/presence_typo/prestige/) has a beautiful and extensive [set of ligatures](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023204555/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/presence_typo/prestige_c_normal/?&sample_text=LoveLaceTourjours&acs_pt=36), including ‘LE’.
Anxious to design it yourself? Come on, a couple of letters.
